description.value: When a pulse gauntlet strikes its target, it releases a surge of sonic energy that can knock the target down. Pulse gauntlets are made of heavy-duty nylon with reinforced pads over the itemsâ€™ knuckles.
A fragmentary, or frag, gren ade explodes in a cloud of shrapnel.
Incendiary grenades detonate in a spray of superheated plasma.

items.name: AG Trooper Battle Dress (Clear Spindle Aeon Stone Jump Jets)

description.value:
>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.oKlwvc1HcIsg7Q7a]{Fighting Style}

The sharpshoot fighting style enables you to excel at making accurate attacks, usually with ranged weapons at a long distance. You can ignore cover and other impediments to your shots, and your attacks are improved by your intense focus.

@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.0sdN8YxzJrN6CXW8]{Sniper's Aim (Ex) (1st)}

When you make a ranged attack against a target with cover, reduce the AC bonus from cover by 2. You canâ€™t use sniperâ€™s aim against an enemy with total cover.

@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.9ESXrnuB1KiSZVKh]{Focus Fire (Ex) (2nd)}

When you make a full attack with a ranged weapon, you can make both attacks with a â€“3 penalty instead of a â€“4 penalty as long as they both target the same creature. If your first attack kills or knocks out the target, you can instead make the second attack against a different creature at a â€“4 penalty. Once you have the soldierâ€™s onslaught class feature (see page 112), you can use this ability with it, making three attacks against the same creature at a â€“5 penalty; if your first or second attack kills or knocks out your target, you can make your remaining attacks against a different creature at a â€“6 penalty.

@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.pDHan7m22IJqR0NR]{Intense Focus (Ex) (3rd)}

When you make a ranged attack against a target with cover or concealment, you can spend 1 Resolve Point to negate its AC bonus from cover and reduce its concealment by one category (from total concealment to concealment or from concealment to no concealment). This benefit applies to all ranged attacks you make against that target this round. You canâ€™t use intense focus more than once per round, nor can you use it against an enemy with total cover.

@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.N8Qqdeeerofp1eTg]{Focused Damage (Ex) (4th)}

When you use focus fire, each attack against the first target deals 2d6 additional damage. Additional creatures you attack after killing or knocking out your first target donâ€™t take this extra damage.

@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.F50g3pNpPhT5n9f3]{Prepared Shot (Ex) (5th)}

As a standard action, you can study a target before you attack. The target must be within line of sight of you and either @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.MZ8OoH1GE9qDMyCD]{Flat-Footed} or unaware of your presence. On the first attack you make against that target on your next turn, you gain a +2 bonus to your attack roll. If your attack hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.aAQ6SW6iK0EVq8Ce]{Staggered} for 1 round; if you score a critical hit, the target is instead @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.CvsDp0GvojxiF2jz]{Stunned} for 1 round. Once you make a prepared shot, you canâ€™t use this ability again against the same target for 24 hours. You canâ€™t make an attack on the same round you study the target, even if an ability would let you attack without spending a standard or full action.

>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.PSAr1JTGPZQ9g1j8]{Sharpshoot}

When you make a ranged attack against a target with cover, reduce the AC bonus from cover by 2. You canâ€™t use sniperâ€™s aim against an enemy with total cover.

Cased rounds are housed in magazines, which can be fitted into the appropriate weapon.

Capacity: 25

Batteries charge powered weapons, but they can also be used to power an array of items, including powered armor and technological items. Batteries have a standardized size and weight, and items that take batteries all have a slot into which they fit, regardless of the itemâ€™s actual size. Weapons that use batteries list the highest-capacity battery they are capable of using as well as how many charges from the battery that each shot consumes.

Capacity: 20

biography.value:
The powerful Azlanti Star Empire maintains its hold on its subject systems through the might of its military, which is divided into two arms: the Imperial Fleet and the Aeon Guard. Aeon Guards are the elite infantry of the Star Empire; they serve as marines aboard the warships of the Imperial Fleet, protect imperial government and military installations, quell dissent and crush rebellions, and spearhead invasions to conquer and occupy new territories for the Star Empire.

Aeon Guards swear personal oaths of loyalty to the Aeon Throne, and only death in service to the empire can release them from their duty. Only humans are accepted into the ranks of the Aeon Guard, and all of them must be paragons of the Azlanti race.

Aeon Guards are readily identifiable by their distinctive armor, which incorporates the magic of the empireâ€™s legendary aeon stones, and many are given cybernetic and biotechnological augmentations in addition to their standard-issue gear. The Aeon Guard stat block on page 6 represents a rank-and-file trooper who can be found almost anywhere within the Azlanti Star Empire or on one of its starships. Aeon Guard specialists are capable of operating for weeks or even months at a time with little or no support, carrying out secretive missions of espionage, infiltration, reconnaissance, or sabotage.

details.organization: fire team (3-6), squad (7-12), strike team (7-12 Aeon Guards plus 1 Aeon Guard specialist), or troop (21-48 Aeon Guards plus 1 Aeon Guard specialist)
